intro: Chesneya isfarensis, commonly known as the Isfahan chesneya, is a rare flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
